title: Foundation: Bachelor's Degree in Education
description: A Bachelor of Education (B.Ed.) provides the perfect foundation, covering pedagogy, learning theories, and educational psychology. Alternatively, a degree in a specific subject you wish to develop curriculum for (e.g., BSc in Physics) is also a strong start.

title: Gain Classroom Teaching Experience
description: Work as a teacher for several years. This is a critical step to understand how curricula are implemented in a real-world setting, the challenges teachers face, and how students interact with learning materials. Without this experience, it's difficult to create practical and effective curricula.

title: Master's Degree in Curriculum & Instruction
description: Pursue a master's degree to specialize in curriculum design. This will equip you with advanced knowledge of instructional design models, assessment strategies, and curriculum theory.
qualifications: Master of Education (M.Ed.) with a specialization in Curriculum Development
salaryRangeLKR: LKR 100,000 - 180,000 (in a role like Academic Coordinator)

title: Curriculum Developer / Instructional Designer
description: Transition into a full-time curriculum development role. You might work for the Ministry of Education, a private school network, an EdTech company, or a publishing house. You'll be responsible for designing, writing, and evaluating educational programs and materials.
qualifications: A portfolio of developed learning materials
institutes: Private school head offices (e.g., Lyceum, Gateway)

title: Senior Curriculum Manager / Head of Academics
description: Advance to a leadership role where you manage a team of developers, oversee the curriculum strategy for an entire institution or product line, and ensure alignment with educational standards and goals.
qualifications: Proven track record of successful curriculum implementation
